markdownRemark.html:
I have a Redux Form that contains a dropdown dependent on the selected value of another dropdown.

It’s all good, I have a filter method to slim down the options from the state and fill my dependent dropdown, and it looks great.

Then I started noticing that I had to manually select a dropdown item from the dependent dropdown to have the value updated in the store.

That’s how I found out about Action Creators, which in short are the internal actions from redux-form exposed so we have complete control to dispatch them as we need.

I was interested in programmatically change the value of a particular field when I filtered the collection to fill the dependent dropdown. redux-form provides the change method for cases like this.

Setting it up was as simple as:

import { bindActionCreators } from 'redux'
const mapDispatchToProps = (dispatch) => ({
  updateField: bindActionCreators((field, data) => {
    change(FORM_NAME, field, data)
  }, dispatch)
})

Then using it:

  this.props.updateField('dependent_field_name', newValue)
